alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 04 at 8:07PM EDT until October 05 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves up to 7 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Northern Outer Banks and Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 8 AM EDT Wednesday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 8 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Residual flooding from recent high tides combined with elevated water levels for the next couple of high tides will continue to cause minor flooding problems. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Coast Guard Hatteras NC MLLW Categories - Minor 2.5 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 4.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 04/04 PM 2.3 1.1 1.3 2 None 05/04 AM 2.4 1.2 1.6 2 None 05/04 PM 2.6 1.4 1.6 2 Minor 06/04 AM 2.3 1.1 1.5 1-2 None 06/05 PM 2.0 0.8 1.0 1 None 07/07 AM 2.0 0.8 1.0 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
